block.p: Elizabeth Bond Jacks, the daughter of Elizabeth Jacks Scott of New York and the late Robert Leroy Jacks, was married yesterday to Kenneth James Dow, a son of Laura and Harry Dow of Hanover, N.H. Thomas Dias, a town justice of Ancram, N.Y., officiated at the house of the bride's parents in Livingston, N.Y.

Ms. Jacks, 31, is keeping her name. She is the director of marketing at the Whitney Museum of American Art in New York. She is also a painter. She graduated cum laude from Duke University and received a master's degree in management from Northwestern. Her father was the manager of planning and control in the civil and environmental affairs department of the Union Carbide Corporation in Danbury, Conn. Her mother is a founding partner in the East Side Family Center, a family therapy practice in New York. The bride's stepfather, Alfred L. Scott, is the president of Scott-Macon, an investment bank in New York.

Elizabeth Bond Jacks, the daughter of Elizabeth Jacks Scott of New York and the late Robert Leroy Jacks, was married yesterday to Kenneth James Dow, a son of Laura and Harry Dow of Hanover, N.H. Thomas Dias, a town justice of Ancram, N.Y., officiated at the house of the bride's parents in Livingston, N.Y.

Ms. Jacks, 31, is keeping her name. She is the director of marketing at the Whitney Museum of American Art in New York. She is also a painter. She graduated cum laude from Duke University and received a master's degree in management from Northwestern. Her father was the manager of planning and control in the civil and environmental affairs department of the Union Carbide Corporation in Danbury, Conn. Her mother is a founding partner in the East Side Family Center, a family therapy practice in New York. The bride's stepfather, Alfred L. Scott, is the president of Scott-Macon, an investment bank in New York.

Mr. Dow, 39, is a senior trader at Valhalla Partners, a private financial trading firm in New York. He graduated from Harvard. His mother retired as a secretary in the athletic department at Dartmouth College in Hanover. His father retired as an estimator at the Dartmouth Printing Company, also in Hanover.
